thread.title: Canes Corner: Staal shushes contract conversation
thread.title_full: Canes Corner: Staal shushes contract conversation

title: Canes Corner: Staal shushes contract conversation
text:
You must enter the characters with black color that stand out from the other characters By Mike Maniscalco 
There has been constant discussion and rumor of Eric Staal's future in Carolina amongst NHL media. With the Hurricanes 0-3 start the conversation gets louder. One of the "stories" was Staal asking for $9 million for his contract extension. 
Staal said Wednesday that he never asked for that number. In fact, he stressed that was a number that had not been demanded. As far as his contract situation, he is comfortable where things stand between him and the organization. Practice notes 
Joakim Nordstrom missed practice Wednesday with an undisclosed ailment. Bill Peters said the forward blocked a shot against Detroit and that Nordstrom hasn't felt right since. He tried to practice but decided best if he sat out. 
Rookie defenseman Noah Hanifin worked with the second power play unit Wednesday. Peters said it remains to be seen if he will be used on the man-advantage in a game. 
With a seven-game road trip coming up, the Hurricanes will call up a forward and a defenseman from Charlotte to give the team extra bodies in case something happens on the road. No decision on who those players will be yet. 
Cam Ward will get the start in the nets against Detroit on Friday. After that, Peters said, they will figure out the goalie situation. Credits
